channel.title: math.AC updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AC updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: The spectrum of a category of maximal Cohen-Macaulay modules
item.description: arXiv:2407.16913v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce an analog of the Ziegler spectrum for maximal Cohen-Macaulay modules over a complete Cohen-Macaulay local ring. We define a topology on the space of isomorphism classes of indecomposable maximal Cohen-Macaulay modules and investigate the topological structure. We also calculate the Cantor-Bendixson rank for a ring which is of CM_+-finite representation type.
item.dc:creator: Naoya Hiramatsu

item.title: Numerical semigroups of coated odd elements
item.description: arXiv:2407.17153v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A numerical semigroup $S$ is coated with odd elements (Coe-semigroup), if $\left\{x-1, x+1\right\}\subseteq S$ for all odd element $x$ in $S$. In this note, we will study this kind of numerical semigroups. In particular, we are interested in the study of the Frobenius number, gender and embedding dimension of a numerical semigroup of this type.
item.dc:creator: J. C. Rosales, M. B. Branco, M. A. Traesel

item.title: The Hessian of elliptic curves
item.description: arXiv:2407.17042v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We prove that the Hessian transformation of a plane projective cubic corresponds to a $3$-endomorphism of a model elliptic curve. By exploiting this result, we investigate a family of functional graphs -- called Hessian graphs -- defined by the Hessian transformation. We show that, over arbitrary fields of characteristics different from $2$ and $3$, the Hessian graphs inherit distinctive features from the arithmetic of the model curve. We then specialize our analysis to the finite-field case, proving several regularities of Hessian graphs.
item.dc:creator: Marzio Mula, Federico Pintore, Daniele Taufer

item.title: Derived functors and Hilbert polynomials over hypersurface rings
item.description: arXiv:2404.14938v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Let $(A,\mathfrak{m})$ be a hypersurface local ring of dimension $d \geq 1$ and let $I$ be an $\mathfrak{m}$-primary ideal. We show that there is a non-negative integer $r_I$ (depending only on $I$) such that if $M$ is any non-free maximal Cohen-Macaulay $A$-module the function $n \rightarrow \ell(Tor^A_1(M, A/I^{n+1}))$ (which is of polynomial type) has degree $r_I$. Analogous results hold for Hilbert polynomials associated to Ext-functors. Surprisingly a key ingredient is the classification of thick subcategories of the stable category of MCM $A$-modules (obtained by Takahashi).
item.dc:creator: Tony J. Puthenpurakal

item.title: $\mathbb{A}^1$-Brouwer degrees in Macaulay2
item.description: arXiv:2312.00106v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We describe the Macaulay2 package "A1BrouwerDegrees" for computing local and global $\mathbb{A}^1$-Brouwer degrees and studying symmetric bilinear forms over the complex numbers, the real numbers, the rational numbers, and finite fields of characteristic not equal to 2.
item.dc:creator: Nikita Borisov, Thomas Brazelton, Frenly Espino, Thomas Hagedorn, Zhaobo Han, Jordy Lopez Garcia, Joel Louwsma, Wern Juin Gabriel Ong, Andrew R. Tawfeek
